column4: Hi folks, I just installed swat on my ubuntu machine and I can't seem to access localhost:901 (where its supposed to be) I have checked the services file and it looks ok - any ideas!?
Hi folks, I just installed swat on my ubuntu machine and I can't seem to access localhost:901 (where its supposed to be) I have checked the services file and it looks ok - any ideas!?
/etc/inetd.conf?
- "#<off># swat  stream tcp nowait.400 root /usr/sbin/tcpd /usr/sbin/swat"  in that file
well, uncomment that line
you might need to restart inetd for the change to have effect
is there a quick way of restarting services?
the proper way would be invoke-rc.d inetd restart.
you could also do it wit /etc/init.d/inetd restart
command not found
invoke-rc.d ??
either of them
invoke-rc.d says it cant find script /etc/init.d/inetd and also inetd does not exist there
hmmm, that's odd
I am getting it using apt-get
all works now - thanx!
cool, odd that you didn't have inetd installed by default
well this is a new 'server' ubuntu install with xubuntu (basically the xfce desktop environment) put on top
still, I find it odd. Propably nothing to worry about though
wow... thats bollox - why on earth do that!
surely I use my root password when sudo-ing ?
